‚ú® How It Works:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Rename your frames with a prefix inside square brackets.

Example:

[1a] Login Page (Row 1, Frame A)

[1b] Password Entry (Row 1, Frame B)

2Ô∏è‚É£ Run the plugin and click "Organize Frames".

3Ô∏è‚É£ Your frames will be arranged into clearly structured groups, placed in order from top to bottom.

Frames without the naming pattern will be placed in an "Others" group at the bottom.

plugins.name: ËßíËêΩËâ∫ÊúØÂÆ∂
plugins.description:
In the new version of "Corner Artist," I've added a language switch feature between Chinese and English. Here, you can freely switch to your preferred language as needed.


The new version optimizes the user experience, making the overall UI more refined and convenient.


By clicking the button, you can randomly switch to your favorite gradient colors.

Additionally, the new version introduces a "Random Corner Radius" feature, allowing you to choose the layer you want to modify and adjust the corner radius strength.


Here, the higher the value, the smaller the corner radius strength.


I‚Äôve used the superellipse corner radius formula:

|x/a|^n + |y/b|^n = 1

When n = 2, it‚Äôs a regular ellipse;

When n < 2, it‚Äôs a superellipse;

The smaller the value of n, the closer the corners are to right angles.


For those interested, you can explore the formula on your own; I‚Äôll post it in the comments.

When you choose a corner radius strength less than 1, you'll also receive stars as a bonus.


That's about it for the new features. Feel free to experience and save them!
plugins.tagline: Making the overall UI more refined and convenient.

plugins.name: Text Color Pairs To Variables
plugins.description:
Usage

  1. Create a frame with any name.
  2. Inside the frame created in step 1, create another frame named variableColorItem.
  3. Inside variableColorItem, create a frame named variableColor.
  4. Set a fill color for variableColor.
  5. Within variableColorItem, create a text layer named variableName.
  6. Select the frame you created in step 1.
  7. Launch the plugin.
  8. Click the button.
  9. The color of variableColor will be registered as a local variable under the name variableName.
plugins.tagline: Generate variables from color and text combinations.

plugins.name: UX Buddy - AI powered pair designer
plugins.description:
UX Buddy is your AI-powered design partner, built to streamline your UX workflow and enhance your design process within Figma.


  1. Uncover Assumptions: Identify and challenge underlying assumptions in your designs.
  2. Discover Edge Cases: Proactively find potential error states and unusual user interactions.
  3. Evaluate Usability: Get AI-driven feedback on the usability of your selected layers based on established heuristics.
  4. Check Accessibility: Perform quick accessibility checks, considering WCAG guidelines for aspects like color contrast and more.
  5. Contextual Analysis: Provide persona details, research insights, and other context to get more tailored feedback from your AI Buddy.
  6. Flexible AI Providers: Connect to various AI services including OpenAI, GroqCloud, Hugging Face, or your local Ollama instance.
  7. Customizable Prompts: Tailor UX Buddy to your specific needs by creating and managing your own prompt library.


Whether you're brainstorming, refining user flows, or conducting detailed evaluations, UX Buddy acts as an intelligent assistant, helping you make more informed design decisions and create better user experiences, faster.


--------

How to set up AI Provider:


‚òÅÔ∏è Option 1: Cloud APIs (OpenAI, GroqCloud, Hugging Face)


Use cloud-based AI models by connecting to one of these supported services.

  1. Select ‚ÄúCloud API‚Äù.
  2. Choose your service (OpenAI, GroqCloud, or Hugging Face) from the dropdown.
  3. Enter your credentials:
  4. OpenAI: API Key from platform.openai.com
  5. ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: OpenAI requires a funded account to use the API. Free trial credits may be available, but ongoing usage requires a billing setup.
  6. GroqCloud: API Key from console.groq.com
  7. Hugging Face: Access Token from huggingface.co/settings/tokens
  8. Enter the Model Name : choose a vision-capable model:
  9. OpenAI: e.g., gpt-4o, gpt-4-vision-preview
  10. GroqCloud: e.g., meta-llama/llama-4-scout-17b-16e-instruct
  11. Hugging Face: e.g., google/gemma-3-27b-it
  12. Click ‚ÄúTest Current AI Connection‚Äù to verify everything works.


-----

üíª Option 2: Ollama (Local AI)


Use Ollama to run models locally on your machine‚Äîno internet required once models are downloaded.


üîß Prerequisites:

  1. Install Ollama: Download it from ollama.com.
  2. Run Ollama:
  3. Launch Ollama via terminal (ollama serve) or the desktop app.
  4. For convenience, you can set it up to run in the background automatically:
  5. macOS: via a plist launch agent
  6. Linux: via a systemd service (Note: These are part of your system configuration and not managed by UX Buddy.)
  7. Download Your Model:
  8. Use ollama pull llava or another vision-enabled model.
  9. Ensure the model supports your desired functionality (e.g., image analysis).


üõ†Ô∏è Configuration in UX Buddy:

  1. Select ‚ÄúOllama‚Äù as your provider.
  2. Enter your API Base URL ‚Äî usually http://localhost:11434.
  3. Enter the Model Name (e.g., llava, llama3, etc.).
  4. Click ‚ÄúTest Current AI Connection‚Äù.
plugins.tagline: Your AI-powered UX design partner.

  3. Evaluate Usability: Get AI-driven feedback on the usability of your selected layers based on established heuristics.
  4. Check Accessibility: Perform quick accessibility checks, considering WCAG guidelines for aspects like color contrast and more.
  5. Contextual Analysis: Provide persona details, research insights, and other context to get more tailored feedback from your AI Buddy.
  6. Flexible AI Providers: Connect to various AI services including OpenAI, GroqCloud, Hugging Face, or your local Ollama instance.
  7. Customizable Prompts: Tailor UX Buddy to your specific needs by creating and managing your own prompt library.


Whether you're brainstorming, refining user flows, or conducting detailed evaluations, UX Buddy acts as an intelligent assistant, helping you make more informed design decisions and create better user experiences, faster.


--------

How to set up AI Provider:


‚òÅÔ∏è Option 1: Cloud APIs (OpenAI, GroqCloud, Hugging Face)


Use cloud-based AI models by connecting to one of these supported services.

  1. Select ‚ÄúCloud API‚Äù.
  2. Choose your service (OpenAI, GroqCloud, or Hugging Face) from the dropdown.
  3. Enter your credentials:
  4. OpenAI: API Key from platform.openai.com
  5. ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: OpenAI requires a funded account to use the API. Free trial credits may be available, but ongoing usage requires a billing setup.
  6. GroqCloud: API Key from console.groq.com
  7. Hugging Face: Access Token from huggingface.co/settings/tokens
  8. Enter the Model Name : choose a vision-capable model:
  9. OpenAI: e.g., gpt-4o, gpt-4-vision-preview
  10. GroqCloud: e.g., meta-llama/llama-4-scout-17b-16e-instruct
  11. Hugging Face: e.g., google/gemma-3-27b-it
  12. Click ‚ÄúTest Current AI Connection‚Äù to verify everything works.


-----

üíª Option 2: Ollama (Local AI)


Use Ollama to run models locally on your machine‚Äîno internet required once models are downloaded.


üîß Prerequisites:

  1. Install Ollama: Download it from ollama.com.
  2. Run Ollama:
  3. Launch Ollama via terminal (ollama serve) or the desktop app.
  4. For convenience, you can set it up to run in the background automatically:
  5. macOS: via a plist launch agent
  6. Linux: via a systemd service (Note: These are part of your system configuration and not managed by UX Buddy.)
  7. Download Your Model:
  8. Use ollama pull llava or another vision-enabled model.
  9. Ensure the model supports your desired functionality (e.g., image analysis).


üõ†Ô∏è Configuration in UX Buddy:

  1. Select ‚ÄúOllama‚Äù as your provider.
  2. Enter your API Base URL ‚Äî usually http://localhost:11434.
  3. Enter the Model Name (e.g., llava, llama3, etc.).
  4. Click ‚ÄúTest Current AI Connection‚Äù.

plugins.name: flowwwww
plugins.description:
Streamline your workflows with flowwwww, the ultimate plugin for creating dynamic connectors between frames, components, and other objects in Figma. Whether you're designing user flows, wireframes, or complex diagrams, flowwwwwempowers you to create professional, customizable connections with ease.


Key Features

Intuitive Connector Creation

Select two frames or components, and flowwwww will instantly generate a connector between them.


Highly Customizable

Personalize your connectors with adjustable properties:

Stroke color and size.

Add text annotations to label your connectors for enhanced clarity.


Smart Obstacle Avoidance

Enable Obstacle Mode to automatically detect and avoid overlapping objects, ensuring clean and unobstructed connectors.

Perfect for complex designs where connectors need to navigate around other elements.



Use Cases

User Flows : Map out user journeys with clear, annotated connectors between screens.

Wireframing : Create structured layouts with precise connections between components.

Technical Diagrams : Build flowcharts, process maps, and other technical illustrations with ease.

Prototyping : Enhance your prototypes with interactive and visually appealing connectors.


How It Works

Install the flowwwww plugin from the Figma Community.

Select two frames, components, or rectangles that you want to connect.


Configure your connector settings (color, style, etc.) via the plugin interface.


Let flowwwww do the rest‚Äîwatch as it creates beautiful, dynamic connectors that adapt to your design.


Why Choose flowwwww?

flowwwww is more than just a connector tool‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity booster for designers who value precision, flexibility, and efficiency. With its robust feature set and seamless integration into Figma, flowwwww is the go-to solution for anyone looking to elevate their design workflow.


Feedback and Support

We‚Äôre committed to making flowwwww the best it can be! If you have any suggestions, encounter issues, or simply love the plugin, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Leave a comment on the Figma Community page or reach out to us directly.


Get Started Today

Install flowwwww now and experience the power of effortless connector creation. Simplify your design process and bring your ideas to life with clarity and precision.
plugins.tagline: Effortless Connector Creation for Figma

plugins.name: Font Theme
plugins.description:
Not all fonts that go well together match the theme of your design. This AI powered plugin lets you describe your design and its intended audience and then suggests font pairs that match the theme you entered. You can also simply just type in the vibe or feeling you want the font to evoke.


The best part? You can save the fonts and all their weights as text styles in your Figma with the click of a button!


The text styles will save the font weights as numbers because that's how developers code font weights. This will ease the communication with your developers because you'll get familiar with how they refer to font weights.

  2. üéØ Purpose-built for Adtraction's reporting structure:

plugins.name: Figma Variable to Code
plugins.description:
This plugin was created to keep Figma variables in sync with variables in the codebase.


For example, you can quickly generate a sass variable for each of the color variables in your Figma file. This ensures your variables in the codebase have the same value and name as the variables in the Figma file.


  1. Load the variable collections
  2. Choose the collection you want to generate variables for
  3. Paste the format you want variable data to be generated in, and replace static content with the dynamic keys in the formatting list
  4. Click generate
  5. Copy the generated variables and put them in the appropriate file in your codebase


Note: If a collection contains groups of variables, each variable from each group is treated as its own unique variable.
plugins.tagline: Format data from Figma variable collections into the syntax you need for your codebase.

plugins.name: Jam Session
plugins.description:
Jam Session lets you run inclusive activities in FigJam.

Start a session as a facilitator and let anybody join by sharing a QR code, unique link or session code. Take control of hybrid or in-person workshop facilities and make sure everyone can inclusively participate.


Learn more at www.jamsesh.xyz


How to use

  1. Start a session with the plugin. Set a timer, an activity prompt, and how you want notes to appear on the board.
  2. Share the QR code or a link with participants. Anybody can join your session on any device through our companion web-app.
  3. Watch submissions roll in. Wait until the timer finishes or end the session early. Affinity map, synth or destroy the results as you please.


Whether you're running an in-person workshop with a FigJam board as the source of truth, or doing something hybrid and just want to ensure everyone can contribute, Jam Session is the tool you never knew you needed.

  1. Keeps the fun alive in workshops
  2. Avoids firewall or laggy machine issues for diverse participants
  3. Gives you control of how submissions appear


Jam Session is in public beta.

A FigJam plugin with this many moving parts may have rough edges. If you find something weird or didn't work, please don't hesitate to reach out to the support email and we'll get right on it.

accepted.description: i do design and design activities

115736.name: Jam Session
115736.description:
Jam Session lets you run inclusive activities in FigJam.

Start a session as a facilitator and let anybody join by sharing a QR code, unique link or session code. Take control of hybrid or in-person workshop facilities and make sure everyone can inclusively participate.


Learn more at www.jamsesh.xyz


How to use

  1. Start a session with the plugin. Set a timer, an activity prompt, and how you want notes to appear on the board.
  2. Share the QR code or a link with participants. Anybody can join your session on any device through our companion web-app.
  3. Watch submissions roll in. Wait until the timer finishes or end the session early. Affinity map, synth or destroy the results as you please.


Whether you're running an in-person workshop with a FigJam board as the source of truth, or doing something hybrid and just want to ensure everyone can contribute, Jam Session is the tool you never knew you needed.

  1. Keeps the fun alive in workshops
  2. Avoids firewall or laggy machine issues for diverse participants
  3. Gives you control of how submissions appear


Jam Session is in public beta.

A FigJam plugin with this many moving parts may have rough edges. If you find something weird or didn't work, please don't hesitate to reach out to the support email and we'll get right on it.

networkAccess.reasoning: Jam Session accesses our own API to start sessions and fetch ongoing submissions, and downloads fonts from our CDN.

115736.tagline: Join FigJam activities from anywhere! Run sessions anybody can join from any device.

plugins.name: Modyo Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
The Modyo Figma Plugin is an essential tool for designers working within the Dynamic Framework. This plugin streamlines your design-to-development workflow with three core functionalities:


Export CSS as Variables: Seamlessly export your design elements as CSS variables tailored for the Dynamic Framework. This feature ensures consistency and speeds up the handoff process, making it easier for developers to implement designs directly from Figma.


Generate Color Palette: Effortlessly create and customize color palettes directly within Figma. This feature allows you to generate a range of colors that can be easily adjusted and applied across your design system, ensuring brand consistency and flexibility.


Font Size Generator Based on PX: Simplify your typography management with a font size generator that operates based on pixel values. This allows for easy creation of a typographic scale that aligns with your design requirements, ensuring responsive and visually appealing text styles.


The Modyo Figma Plugin is designed to empower designers and developers, making collaboration smoother and more efficient by providing a unified toolkit for creating consistent and high-quality UI components.
plugins.tagline: A plugin for Dynamic Framework

plugins.name: Data Bloom
plugins.description:
Data Bloom is your go-to plugin for breathing life into your Figma designs. Easily replace generic dummy text with real-looking, localized content and user data tailored to your audience. Now supporting 10 languages with 10+ data type options (see below), Data Bloom will continue expanding to include more languages and data types.


Supported languages:

üá¶üáø Azerbaijani, üá∫üá∏ English (USA), üá©üá™ German, üá∞üáø Kazakh, üá∞üá¨ Kyrgyz, üá∑üá∫ Russian, üáπüá∑ Turkish, üáπüá≤ Turkmen, üá∫üá¶ Ukrainian, üá∫üáø Uzbek


Available data types:

üé≤ Random: Generates a data point by randomly selecting from any of the other available data types.

üë´üèª Names: Creates realistic first names, last names, or full names, with options for gender.

ü§™ Playful Usernames: Produces fun and quirky usernames, optionally starting with an "@" symbol.

üìû Phone Numbers: Generates phone numbers with various formatting options, including country-specific domestic styles.

üí≥ Payment card details: Helps to generate mock payment card information, such as Card numbers, Expiry date and CVV/CVC

‚≠êÔ∏è Ratings and reviews: Generate localized generic review text from categories like "General", "Product specific" or "App feedback"

üìÜ Date: Creates date values with customizable formats and selectable year ranges, including custom inputs.

üìÜ Days of the week: Inserts day names (e.g., Monday, Tuesday)

üìÜ Months: Populates layers with month names (e.g., January, February)

üíº Professions: Populates layers with a diverse list of job titles and occupations.

üé® Colors: Replaces selected text layers with common color names.


Whether you‚Äôre designing a prototype or building a demo, Data Bloom makes it effortless to populate text layers in seconds, ensuring your prototypes feel authentic, personalized, and polished.


‚ú¶ Lightning-fast generation

‚ú¶ Realistic, localized data (Names, Phone Numbers, Colors, Usernames and Professions)

‚ú¶ Lightweight and Figma-friendly

‚ú¶ Continuous updates with new languages and data types


Replace ‚Äúlorem ipsum‚Äù forever ‚Äî grow your designs with Data Bloom.


üå± How-to Guide:

  1. Run the Data Bloom plugin.
  2. Select one or multiple text layers in your design where you want to insert random data.
  3. Choose a preferred data language and data type from the list.
  4. Click ‚ÄúGenerate Data‚Äù and the plugin will instantly populate the selected text layers based on your set preferences.

plugins.name: SmartTableFill
plugins.description:
SmartTableFill is a GPT-powered plugin designed for intelligent table population with contextual data. Unlike basic data fillers, SmartTableFill analyzes existing content to generate relevant entries, making it ideal for tasks like: creating email addresses based on user names, generating addresses aligned with specified cities, or calculating percentages based on given numbers.


Choose between basic and contextual modes to quickly populate tables for mockups, prototyping, and presentations. Customizable settings allow you to target specific text nodes, saving time on manual entry and bringing a smarter approach to data generation.

plugins.name: Text With Styles
plugins.description:
# Flutter Text Style Inspector


A powerful Figma plugin that bridges the gap between Figma text styles and Flutter's Material Design text theme system. This plugin helps developers and designers maintain consistency between Figma designs and Flutter implementations by automatically mapping Figma text styles to their corresponding Flutter TextTheme properties.


## Features


### Real-time Style Inspection

- Instantly view text style information for any selected text layer

- Live updates as you select different text elements

- Support for multiple text selection with smart duplicate filtering


### Comprehensive Style Information

- Displays the complete Figma text style name

- Shows associated color token information

- Previews the actual text content

- Automatically generates corresponding Flutter TextTheme code


### Smart Flutter Code Generation

- Automatically maps Figma text styles to Flutter's Material Design text theme

- Supports all standard Material text styles:

- Headlines (Large, Medium, Small)

- Titles (Large, Medium, Small)

- Body text (with weight variations)

- Labels (Large, Medium, Small)

- Includes font weight handling for body styles (w400, w500, w600)


### User-Friendly Interface

- Clean, organized display of style information

- Easy-to-copy Flutter code snippets

- Compact, floating UI that stays out of your way

- Simple click-outside-to-close functionality


## How to Use


1. Select any text layer(s) in your Figma design

2. The plugin will automatically display:

- The applied Figma text style

- The color token (if available)

- A preview of the text content

- The equivalent Flutter TextTheme code

3. Copy the generated Flutter code directly into your application


## Best Practices


- Name your Figma text styles to match Material Design conventions for automatic mapping

- Use consistent style names to ensure accurate Flutter code generation

- Apply color styles to text layers for complete token information

- Select multiple text layers to quickly inspect all text styles in a component


Perfect for teams working with both Figma and Flutter, this plugin streamlines the handoff process and ensures design consistency across platforms.
plugins.tagline: Select any layer and get its texts with styles
